strengths: Parallel agent execution with Promise.allSettled and 3-agent quorum in route.ts is textbook resilient orchestration -- agents fail independently, synthesis proceeds with partial results, and the fallback synthesis path ensures the system never leaves the user hanging

Validation layer in validate.ts (831 lines) is comprehensive -- 8 distinct validators with typed error details at every data boundary (usePanelStream validates SSE payloads, try-storage.ts validates on read from Redis/filesystem), forming a genuine trust boundary between AI output and the application

Clean module decomposition -- each module has a single job with clear interfaces (types.ts defines schema, validate.ts enforces it, try-agents.ts configures agents, github.ts fetches repos), and 94/94 tests across 8 files confirm the architecture holds under scrutiny
weaknesses: 4 of 5 iter-7 action items remain unresolved: no tests for validateTryPanelResult (P1), no extracted agent-invocation helper (P2), no agent response schema validation before synthesis (P3), no RSC smoke tests (P4) -- only the DivergentOpinions key fix (P5) was addressed, revealing a compound learning gap

Agent response parsing in route.ts uses loose casting (data.strengths as [string, string, string]) without calling validateAgentEvaluation, meaning malformed AI output passes silently into synthesis -- the validation infrastructure exists but is not wired into the most critical data path

Board builder at boards/build/page.tsx line 474 still uses key={idx} for the agents map despite being flagged in iter-7 -- agents can be added/removed/reordered, making index keys a functional correctness bug

action_items.action: Wire validateAgentEvaluation into route.ts agent response parsing after parseAgentJSON, before constructing TryAgentResult.
action_items.impact: Closes iter-7 P3. Prevents garbage-in-garbage-out in synthesis. Verification +5.

action_items.action: Add 6-8 dedicated tests for validateTryPanelResult in validate.test.ts.
action_items.impact: Closes iter-7 P1. Most-used web validator has zero test coverage. Verification +3.

action_items.action: Extract agent invocation logic into standalone try-invoke.ts module.
action_items.impact: Closes iter-7 P2. Improves architecture modularity.

action_items.action: Fix key={idx} in boards/build/page.tsx. Add stable ID to BuilderAgent.
action_items.impact: Closes iter-7 Lydia P2. Prevents React reconciliation bugs.

action_items.action: Add one RSC smoke test for homepage and /results page.
action_items.impact: Closes iter-7 P4. Catches RSC errors pre-deploy.

agents.one_line: Strong architecture with genuine verification at data boundaries, but 4/5 previous action items unresolved reveals a compound learning gap that needs closing.

strengths: Try-It-Now flow is the strongest product decision -- zero install, paste URL, watch 6 agents stream results in real time with per-agent progress cards, demonstrating value before the user reads a single doc
Narrative is exceptional and memorable -- 'We did not get a spot. So we built the judges.' creates emotional resonance, explains the origin, and implies ambition. Landing page tells a coherent story.
Board Builder demonstrates real extensibility -- 2-8 agents with weight rebalancing, criteria per agent, YAML export, localStorage save, 5 built-in templates showing range of evaluation scenarios
weaknesses: 3 of 4 iter-7 action items unresolved: no dashboard/README.md, no OG/Twitter Card metadata on shareable pages, no visual audit-fix-re-audit loop section
Free tier at 3 reviews/hour with no clear upgrade path -- no Anthropic signup link, no cost guidance, BYOK explanation is cryptic to users unfamiliar with model hierarchy
Shareable results page uses static metadata instead of dynamic generateMetadata with OG tags -- significantly reduces viral potential on social media

action_items.action: Add dynamic generateMetadata with OG tags to /results/web/[auditId] pages.
action_items.impact: Rich social previews increase click-through. Narrative +2, market_fit +3.

action_items.action: Add dashboard/README.md with env var documentation.
action_items.impact: Removes contributor friction. Adoption_path +2.

action_items.action: Add 'What Happens Next?' visual loop section on landing page.
action_items.impact: Makes closed-loop improvement visible. User_value +1, narrative +1.

action_items.action: Add Anthropic API key signup link and cost guidance next to BYOK input.
action_items.impact: Clear upgrade path for engaged free users.

agents.one_line: Genuinely delightful Try-It-Now flow and the most memorable narrative in a hackathon project, but lack of OG metadata on shareable pages is leaving viral growth on the table.

strengths: Adaptive thinking budgets in EFFORT_BUDGET_MAP correctly calibrate cognitive effort per agent -- thariq gets max=20000, boris/lydia get high=10000, cat gets medium=5000. Genuine model-capability alignment wired through to the API call.

Debate architecture creates genuine multi-agent synthesis -- sorting by composite, top vs bottom agent adversarial exchange, transcript appended to synthesis prompt. Three-phase pipeline: independent evaluation, adversarial challenge, unified synthesis.
Model routing is well-documented and justified -- Opus for deep analysis, Sonnet for structured evaluation, Haiku for free tier. Thinking only enabled for BYOK Opus agents. Smart cost awareness.
weaknesses: 1M context window completely unused -- MAX_TOTAL_CHARS hardcoded to 80KB with 10-file cap regardless of tier. BYOK users paying for Opus get the same context as free tier. Biggest missed opportunity.
No cross-iteration context -- system saves to Redis but never reads previous reviews for same repo. Each review is entirely stateless. No self-improvement mechanism.
Agents are single-turn text generators with no tool access. No multi-turn reasoning, no ability to request additional files. Debate uses Sonnet instead of Opus, undercutting depth.

action_items.action: Implement tier-aware file selection: BYOK gets 400KB+/40+ files via getTierLimits(tier).
action_items.impact: opus_usage +12. Agents see 5x more codebase.

action_items.action: Cross-iteration context: check Redis for previous reviews of same repo, append prior scores/weaknesses to prompt.
action_items.impact: emergent_behavior +10. Compound intelligence.

action_items.action: Upgrade debate to use Opus for BYOK tier instead of Sonnet.
action_items.impact: emergent_behavior +5. Deeper reasoning in adversarial exchange.

action_items.action: Add selective tool access for at least one agent (file request mid-evaluation).
action_items.impact: ai_innovation +5. Moves from prompt-in/JSON-out to actual agentic behavior.

agents.one_line: Solid multi-agent architecture with genuine adaptive thinking and debate, but the 80KB context cap wastes the 1M window and lack of cross-iteration memory means the system never gets smarter.

strengths: TypeScript strictness exemplary -- strict:true, noUncheckedIndexedAccess, zero `any` types, `as const satisfies Record<string,string>`, 512 lines of canonical interfaces with discriminated unions, tuple types, and literal types

Validation architecture in validate.ts is genuinely impressive -- P1 double-cast fix confirmed resolved. usePanelStream.ts line 168 now calls validateTryPanelResult(data) instead of the previous `as unknown as` cast.
Accessibility and motion-sensitivity handled with care -- useReducedMotion in 8 components, ARIA progressbars, skip-to-content link, focus-visible consistently applied across all interactive elements
weaknesses: key={idx} still in boards/build/page.tsx line 474 on dynamic agent list (iter-7 P2 unresolved) -- agents can be added/removed/reordered, making this a correctness bug for stale form state

usePanelStream still has 7 useState hooks (iter-7 P3 unresolved) that update together in both reset() and startReview() -- textbook useReducer candidate, pattern already demonstrated in boards/build/page.tsx
Strengths/weaknesses list rendering duplicated across 4+ components (AgentCard, StreamingAgentCard, PanelAgentCard, PanelSynthesisView) without shared abstraction -- ~120 lines of duplicated JSX

action_items.action: Add stable ID to BuilderAgent, change key={idx} to key={agent.id} in boards/build/page.tsx.
action_items.impact: Fixes React reconciliation bug on mutable list. Second iteration flagged.

action_items.action: Consolidate usePanelStream 7 useState into useReducer with PanelStreamState/PanelStreamAction.
action_items.impact: Eliminates intermediate renders, makes SSE state machine explicit. Second iteration flagged.

action_items.action: Extract shared EvaluationList component from AgentCard ListSection.
action_items.impact: Reduces ~120 lines of duplicated JSX across 4 components.

action_items.action: Add aria-describedby linking API key input to hint text in TryForm.tsx.
action_items.impact: Screen readers announce security hint on focus.

action_items.action: Add Suspense/lazy loading for RadarChart in PanelSynthesisView.
action_items.impact: Defers recharts bundle until synthesis complete.

agents.one_line: TypeScript strictness best-in-class with zero `any` types and full validation coverage, but the same two iter-7 issues persist: key={idx} on mutable list and 7 useState hooks that should be useReducer.

strengths: Documentation exceptional -- 189-line README with quickstart in first 45 lines, 3 install options, visual command table, time to first value under 5 minutes
Accessibility production-grade -- focus-visible on 35+ elements across 19 files, ARIA progressbars, skip-to-content link, useReducedMotion in 8 components, semantic HTML throughout
Community infrastructure complete -- MIT License, CONTRIBUTING.md, CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md (Contributor Covenant 2.1), SECURITY.md, bug_report + feature_request issue templates, CI pipeline
weaknesses: No demo GIF showing audit-fix-improvement cycle (iter-7 P1 unresolved) -- README has 3 screenshots but the 30-second workflow GIF that communicates value faster than prose is still missing
CHANGELOG [0.5.0] omits iteration 6 accessibility improvements (WCAG compliance, focus-visible, useReducedMotion) -- the primary work of that iteration is invisible in release notes
No .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md (iter-7 P2 unresolved) -- CONTRIBUTING.md says 'Open a PR' but provides no checklist

action_items.action: Create .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md with checklist.
action_items.impact: Community +3. Shows contribution path is complete.

action_items.action: Add 30-second quickstart GIF to README.
action_items.impact: Examples +5, documentation +2. 30 seconds vs 189 lines.

action_items.action: Update CHANGELOG to include accessibility improvements.
action_items.impact: Documentation accuracy. Currently invisible work.

action_items.action: Add API documentation page covering data loaders and key types.
action_items.impact: Documentation +3 for dashboard contributors.

action_items.action: Create examples/custom-panel-walkthrough.md.
action_items.impact: Examples +4. Full flow tutorial.

agents.one_line: Outstanding documentation and accessibility engineering with complete community infrastructure, but the demo GIF and PR template from iter-7 are still missing.

strengths: Production-ready Try-It-Now at boardclaude.com lowers barrier dramatically -- non-developers can paste a GitHub URL and see a full 6-agent panel review with no install, no CLI knowledge
Board Builder with localStorage persistence and YAML export enables community-driven panel creation and sharing. 4 templates provide starting points for common use cases.
Narrative quality exceptional -- 'We Didn't Get a Spot. So We Built the Judges.' is a compelling origin story. README comprehensive with screenshots showing progressive disclosure.
weaknesses: i18n still cosmetic -- messages.ts exists but NOT wired to i18n framework, three toLocaleString('en-US') calls remain hardcoded, no dir='auto' on html, no logical CSS properties, Inter font latin-only
Zero onboarding affordances for first-time users -- Board Builder and Try-It-Now have no tooltips, no progressive disclosure hints. Non-developer on /boards/build sees form fields with no guidance.
No README badges, no GitHub Discussions, no PR template. CONTRIBUTING.md exists but Discussions would create a community forum for shared panels and troubleshooting.

action_items.action: Wire messages.ts to next-intl with locale detection and switching UI.
action_items.impact: Raises internationalization from 44 to 70+. Shows global readiness.

action_items.action: Add dir='auto' to html, replace directional CSS with logical properties.
action_items.impact: Fixes RTL layout for 300M+ Arabic/Hebrew speakers.

action_items.action: Add tooltips to Board Builder and Try-It-Now form fields.
action_items.impact: Lowers barrier for non-developer users. Community_impact +8.

action_items.action: Add verdict icons for color-blind users, patterns on radar chart.
action_items.impact: Fixes color-only reliance for 8% of male users.

action_items.action: Enable GitHub Discussions, add README badges, add PR template.
action_items.impact: Signals project health, enables community sharing.

agents.one_line: Production-ready with compelling narrative and strong integration, but i18n is still performative -- messages.ts extracts strings but they are not localized, RTL is unsupported.

top_strengths: Try-It-Now flow with zero-install, paste-URL experience dramatically lowers adoption barrier -- non-developers can evaluate projects at boardclaude.com with no CLI setup. Confirmed by Cat, Jason, and Ado.

Validation architecture in validate.ts is production-grade with 8 distinct validators, typed error details at every boundary, and 94/94 test coverage -- iter-7 P1 double-cast fix confirmed resolved. Confirmed by Boris and Lydia.

Documentation and accessibility are exceptional -- 189-line README with <5min time-to-value, ARIA progressbars, useReducedMotion in 8 components, focus-visible on 35+ elements, complete community infrastructure. Confirmed by Ado, Lydia, and Jason.
top_weaknesses: Iter-7 action items largely unresolved across all agents -- 4/5 Boris items, 3/4 Cat items, key={idx} still present (Lydia), i18n still cosmetic (Jason), no PR template (Ado). The audit-fix loop is identifying issues but not closing them. Flagged by all 6 agents.

1M context window completely unused -- MAX_TOTAL_CHARS hardcoded to 80KB with 10-file cap regardless of tier, no cross-iteration context, agents are single-turn without tool access. Massive underutilization of Opus 4.6 capabilities. Flagged by Thariq.

Agent response parsing in route.ts uses loose casting without validateAgentEvaluation, allowing malformed AI output to pass silently into synthesis -- the validation infrastructure exists but is not wired into the most critical data path. Flagged by Boris.

agent_a.position: Innovation score 76, opus_usage 68, emergent_behavior 58 -- context window unused, no cross-iteration memory, single-turn agents, debate uses Sonnet not Opus

agent_b.position: Code quality 90, patterns 88 -- TypeScript strictness exemplary, validation impressive, architecture sound

divergent_opinions.analysis: Thariq sees unfulfilled AI potential (single-turn, no tools, 1M context unused), while Lydia focuses on implementation quality. Both are correct -- the code that exists is excellent, but it doesn't leverage advanced model capabilities. For a hackathon judged on AI innovation, Thariq's lens matters more.

agent_a.position: Documentation and accessibility at a level where a developer would trust this project within 5 minutes. README, CONTRIBUTING, community infrastructure are exemplary.

agent_b.position: English-only with hardcoded locales, no RTL support, no i18n framework despite having centralized messages.ts. i18n score: 44/100.

divergent_opinions.analysis: Ado evaluates English-language developer experience which is exceptional. Jason evaluates global accessibility which is near-zero. The project is excellent for English-speaking developers but structurally excludes 85% of the world's population. For a hackathon, English-first is pragmatic; for production, it's a blocker.

action_items.action: Wire validateAgentEvaluation into route.ts before constructing TryAgentResult to prevent malformed AI output from passing silently into synthesis.
action_items.impact: Prevents synthesis crashes, improves verification score +3-5 points. Closes iter-7 Boris P3.

action_items.impact: Enables viral sharing on social media. Narrative +2, market_fit +3. Closes iter-7 Cat P4.

action_items.action: Implement tier-aware file selection: increase BYOK tier to 400KB+ / 40+ files via getTierLimits(tier) in github.ts.
action_items.impact: Unlocks 1M context window for paying users. opus_usage +8-12 points.

action_items.action: Fix key={idx} in boards/build/page.tsx -- add stable ID (crypto.randomUUID()) to BuilderAgent, use key={agent.id}.
action_items.impact: Fixes React reconciliation bug on mutable list. Consensus issue across 2 agents, 2 iterations.

action_items.action: Consolidate usePanelStream 7 useState hooks into useReducer with PanelStreamState/PanelStreamAction discriminated union.
action_items.impact: Eliminates intermediate renders, makes SSE state machine explicit. Patterns +2-3.

action_items.action: Add cross-iteration context: check Redis for previous reviews of same repo, append prior scores and action items to agent prompts.
action_items.impact: Creates compound intelligence. emergent_behavior +8-10 points.

action_items.action: Create .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md with checklist (tests, types, prettier, screenshots).
action_items.impact: Completes community infrastructure. Consensus across 2 agents.

action_items.action: Add 6-8 dedicated tests for validateTryPanelResult covering valid data, missing fields, malformed agents, invalid tier.
action_items.impact: Most-used web validator has zero test coverage. Verification +3.

improvements: usePanelStream now uses validateTryPanelResult instead of double-cast (Lydia P1 resolved)
DivergentOpinions key uses topic instead of index (Boris P5 resolved)
Adaptive thinking budgets and debate round confirmed working correctly
regressions: Most iter-7 action items unresolved across all agents -- compound learning gap flagged by Boris (78 compound_learning)
Thariq scores flat (71.3 vs 68.9 iter-7): context window and cross-iteration memory still unaddressed
Jason scores slightly up (78.3 vs 75.8) but i18n remains 44/100 with zero progress
